text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/c5acc0f7fed6b061d994fc5ac660dcc0312750bd|patch 8.2.0892: ubsan warns for undefined behavior>
patch 8.2.0892: ubsan warns for undefined behavior

Problem:    Ubsan warns for undefined behavior.
Solution:   Use unsigned instead of signed variable. (Dominique Pelle,
            closes #6193)

attachments.title: patch 8.2.0892: ubsan warns for undefined behavior · vim/vim@c5acc0f
attachments.text: Problem: Ubsan warns for undefined behavior. Solution: Use unsigned instead of signed variable. (Dominique Pelle, closes #6193)

patch 8.2.0893: assert_equalfile() does not take a third argument

Solution:   Implement the third argument. (Gary Johnson)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/59f88fbf24b21dbae114a79a15695fa2c3a09fca|patch 8.2.0894: :mkspell can take very long if the word count is high>
patch 8.2.0894: :mkspell can take very long if the word count is high

Problem:    :mkspell can take very long if the word count is high.
Solution:   Use long to avoid negative numbers.  Increase the limits by 20% if
            the compression did not have effect.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0894: :mkspell can take very long if the word count is high · vim/vim@59f88fb
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0894: :mkspell can take very long if the word count is high · vim/vim@59f88fb
attachments.text: Problem: :mkspell can take very long if the word count is high. Solution: Use long to avoid negative numbers. Increase the limits by 20% if the compression did not have effect.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/408c23b0794540ee3c568a1569f21406c5ed3ab8|patch 8.2.0895: :mkspell output does not mention the tree type>
patch 8.2.0895: :mkspell output does not mention the tree type

Problem:    :mkspell output does not mention the tree type.
Solution:   Back out increasing the limits, it has no effect.  Mention the
            tree being compressed.  Only give a message once per second.

patch 8.2.0896: crash when calling searchcount() with a string

Problem:    Crash when calling searchcount() with a string.
Solution:   Check the argument is a dict. (closes #6192)

attachments.title: patch 8.2.0896: crash when calling searchcount() with a string · vim/vim@1468162
